Reviews.Title: “Third visit”
Reviews.Author: Nmantle
Reviews.Content: We have been to Branson twice before and loved it at the Colonnade Resort. Beautiful accomodations and friendly service.. we are going again this year and are staying at the Colonnade again..I think we would always choose where we were most comfortable

Reviews.Title: “New Owners Are Remodeling”
Reviews.Author: bguinn
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is a work in progress. The new owner, Inderjit and manager staff - Jack, Mike and Kathy along with Vickie are working long hours to make things right. This cannot happen overnight when the previous owner's left it in bad shape. So be patient. In August we had no problems in our unit and all the new employees, along with Inderjit's son and daughter were extremely friendly and courteous. We are owners since 1997 and have faith that the Colonnade will come out stronger in the end. So you visitors of the Colonnade - don't give up on it - give it another shot. As far as coffee - there is a coffeemaker in the lobby now. The pool and hot tub are all clean and in working order.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Colonade Hotel in Branson, Missouri. My room was clean and very comfortable. I had everthing I needed. I could see some work was being done while I was there and had a chance to talk with Jack the new manager. He was very personable, and I was welcomed by him and his staff. Mitchell offered his assistance a couple of times and I was pleased with my room and the service I received. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Getting Update”
Reviews.Author: cehebard
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is getting a great face-lift. The last owners let it go too long.The people here are very friendly and helpful. They will have the breakfast back later this month and the pool movies. Will be coming back in September.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Mjglenn1
Reviews.Content: This place needs updating and cleaning desperately. The "breakfast" was a joke. They hardly had anything at all available and we were told by staff they had to cut back on what they were allowed to put out. The staff in the lobby were friendly for the most part except for one person. We had been told we would be in an updated unit (two bedroom, two bath). When we requested another unit since our's was not updated we were told they were completely full. They had maybe 7 cars in the dark unlit parking lot. The other staff told us they had lots of empty rooms. Pool and hot tub were both empty (no water). Air conditioner/heater units were old and smelled of mildew. Room was non smoking but smelled

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abby2Missouri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need for a complete update. The light is not turned on at night which made it hard to find when ask about it ws told "THATS THE WAY THE OWNERS WANT IT".I will never stay again, the carpet was filthy, the sink looked like it had never been cleaned, the lid on the toilet stool was not even there and the bath room was so small it was needed to lay items on.I had to sleep with my socks on because I didn't want to get up in the night and walk on the dirty floor. The sheet and towels were thin as paper. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The only plus ws the nice young lady at the desk, she needs to move on to a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: ladybug314
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay although the place is a little outdated. Staff was friendly and the people selling tickets were very helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Linda Z
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently bought our 14 year old niece and 5 of her girlfriends into Boston for the weekend and we stayed in a suite at the colonnade hotel. It was just perfect. We started the weekend with breakfast for 12 in the main dining room and we had a round table which was perfect. Everyone loved their pancakes, waffles, eggs and fresh baked bread. Later that night we all enjoyed room service. The girls loved it, chicken tenders, club sandwich, burgers, pizza and you name it we had it! The service was prompt and everything arrived hot and couldn't have been better! It was a weekend that the girls will forever remember and we have received many words of thanks. It was the friendly staff, the food and the accommodations that helped to make it a memorable weekend and everyone would love to do it again this weekend! Well, maybe next weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: kitiluv
Reviews.Content: We really loved this resort. Michele and Robin were super friendly and helpful. Gary, the travel guy, was very knowledgeable about all there was to do in Branson and the best things for your money. The owner was very nice as well. There were lots of smiles. Everyone there wanted to make sure you had everything you needed. The unit we stayed in was beautiful and spacious. We had 3 kids and had plenty of room. The pool was closed for the season, but we stayed in and rented movies at the redbox. We will never have to look for a place to stay in Branson again. This is the only place we want to stay... And it is super close to everything. Our favorite restaurants were Chester's, McFarlain's, Montana Mike's, Charlie's, Florentina's for Italian, and the Plaza View.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: jkbdfw
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently updated and spacious. The Colonnade is next to the back roads of Branson, twhich will save you lots of time versus driving the main drag. The people were very nice and helpful, even after we declined their timeshare offer. Be sure to use the colored routes in Branson. You will save yourself hours of driving. The train ride in Branson is a bust, the Showboat was great, the Payne Stewart Golf Course was challenging and beautiful, while the Ledgestone Golf Course had some sort of fungus which chewed up the greens, making putting impossible. Ledgestone should have closed the course or let golfers know of the terrible conditions in advance of play.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort and staff”
Reviews.Author: ocasionalshopper
Reviews.Content: Delighted with this centrally located resort. Staff was wonderful, condo was beautiful and the pool was a big bonus in the hot weather. The Monday night entertainment was 20+ giving mini-shows or information about things in Branson. We chose three to attend and were pleased with the performances and discounts. The elevators are necessary for us and the level parking. Would love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous condos”
Reviews.Author: mystic11SanDiego
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has not been to the Colonnade in the past few months should definitely go back and check out the condos now. We were there a year ago and weren't impressed but we decided to give it another chance. The rooms have all been totally redone. The furniture is equal to any 5 start condo I have every stayed in. I didn't see the the hotel rooms on the two bottom floors, only the condos. The free owners party on Monday night was the best I've ever attended. There must have been at least 20 Branson entertainers perform and more food than one could eat. The free breakfast included danish, waffles, fruit, yogurt, cereal, juices, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good hearted staff, but kinda icky”
Reviews.Author: oscarsmaman
Reviews.Content: The exterior, lobby, and common areas are all fine-- nice, even, but the rooms were pretty icky. The sink had suspicious brown stains, the furniture was dated, the carpet was slightly sticky, but someone left part of a pretzel for us on the floor (as a snack, I guess). The upside was, it was fairly inexpensive, and we weren't planning to stay there long. The location is great and the staff was wonderful. I wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends, but it's not bad for a large group and if you want to save money. Also, the pool was closed, since it's outside (and it was freezing).

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING OLDER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mariejackson
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending three nights with my mother and two sisters. We were given a handicap room which I thought was small. The tub was higher than most tubs in other hotels. It did have a seat in the tub for my mother to use but to get out was higher than she could handle. When we arrived the clerk was extremely friendly and helpful. The lobby was clean and elegant. Upon opening the door we found the room clean. The beds were okay but the pillows were flat. We did ask for four more pillows which we were given with a smile. The next day after returning to our room the beds were made and we had fresh towels but the bathroom sink was not touched. It still had toothpaste and hair as we left it. The same piece of lint was on the bathroom floor all three days which tells me they did not sweep the floors. The breakfast was just okay. They had hot and cold cereal, yogurt, wheat bread for toasting, ready made waffles, individual wrapped very small sausage and biscuit sandwiches, individual wrapped egg burritos, bananas (the only fruit they offered), cake donuts, coffee and juices. The sandwiches and burritos were cold and you had to cook them yourself in the microwave. The breakfast was suppose to be until 9:30 and one day around 9:15 the girl taking care of the breakfast was cleaning up and putting food away. One day they ran out of fruit and yogurt. So I suggest going early. I know there is no thing as a perfect hotel but if you want a hotel that is located off the busy streets and friendly staff this is your hotel. What we liked about the hotel was indoor corridors and mostly flat parking. Even though they did not clean our room and the breakfast was not the best I would probably stay here again. Most of the rooms or units were time share. We were not asked to listen to a presentation or asked to buy a unit(I really appreciated that).

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: thebunches
Reviews.Content: LOVED everything! It was exactly what our family needed. The staff was wonderful and hospitable. the hotel was clean and beds very comfortable. the pool was fantastic. we had the best mini vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: imxeniasmom
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort after being contacted by RCI fun trips, I was offered 3 nights and 4 days at this "resort" for the price of $149, I was told upon arrival I would recieve 2 tickets to a major attraction as well as recieve $100 back after touring the "resort, time share informational" I was told we would have 2 rooms. Upon check in I was told our tour would take place on the following Monday, we were set to check out on tuesday, I was told we had no coupons to the attraction and was told to call Fun Trips to get them sent over, however as it was Sat. no one was there to answer my phone call, I did leave a message, We had one small room for my husband, my self and 2 teenage girls. We ended up renting the a joining room. The hot tub NEVER was working the entire weekend. I had to go find the house keeper around 7:30 pm the second day in order to get our room cleaned, When a soda got spilled on a bed the third day and I requested clean bed linins around 11 am I was given a set of sheets by the house keeping staff. When fun trips finally did get back to us they gave us the run around for 2 1/2 hours, eventually they set us up with tickets to the Legends Review that was starting in 30 min. The show was wonderful however the effort it took to get the tickets was uncalled for. We did go thru the timeshare informational, and made it very plain I would never spend my hard earned money to get a time share at a third rate run down old motel. If your looking for a time share deal then I suggest you look at Stoney Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Own”
Reviews.Author: Milllin
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal location for us! The rooms are big and roomy. We love it. We own here and it trades very well. We stay about every other year and enjoy it. Very quiet, but close to everything. Nice pool and hot tub. Great breakfast. Hot meal and it is free. They are keeping up with maintenance and upgrading. Staff is wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Resort?”
Reviews.Author: Holly-Daze61
Reviews.Content: I would not call this a "resort". There is one pool and hot tub, standard sized. Breakfast meager to average - donuts, 2 types of cereal, no milk for it, no juice. That was it. Hotel room was clean, but average in features.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TheLoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Colonnade for a week (May 12-19). Was very pleased with the room. The Colonnade is very nicely located so that ii is easy to get to, quiet, yet convenient to attractions and shopping. The unit I was in was very nicely appointed, had a full kitchen (including dishwasher), a huge bathroom with a whirlpool tub, and a very large bedroom with a King bed. The living room had a full sized couch, a recliner, and a TV with a vcr/dvd combo. Dishes, silverware, pots and pans, toaster, coffee maker, and even a blender were all provided in the kitchen. They served a breakfast each morning that included biscuits and gravy, cereal, toaster waffles, and donuts. If you are a shopaholic, the Tanger Outlet is practically next door, and the Factory Merchant Mall is within a 2 minute drive. I really enjoyed my stay at the colonnade and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: texasrocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights during July 4th holiday. The rates were very reasonable, rooms are nicer than what I was expecting, very clean, no problems. It's right off of the main strip in Branson so very convenient.

HotelInfo.Name: Colonnade Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 245 Jess Jo, Branson, MO 65616
